description: Checks in databases with more than 235 GB allocation limit  if gc_unused_memory_threshold_rel/gc_unused_memory_threshold_abs was set to SAP recommended value .This parameter helps to reduce the risk of hiccups (e.g. due to MemoryReclaim waits) when garbage collection happens reactively

queries.name: q_allocation_limit
queries.sql: select count(*) AS VALUE from M_SERVICE_MEMORY where ALLOCATION_LIMIT > '252329328640' and SERVICE_NAME='indexserver'

queries.name: q_mem_threshold_rel
queries.sql: SELECT VALUE FROM M_INIFILE_CONTENTS WHERE FILE_NAME = 'global.ini' AND SECTION= 'memorymanager' AND KEY = 'gc_unused_memory_threshold_rel' AND (LAYER_NAME = 'DATABASE' OR LAYER_NAME = 'DEFAULT') AND VALUE > '0' ORDER BY LAYER_NAME ASC LIMIT 1

queries.name: q_mem_threshold_abs
queries.sql: SELECT count(*) as VALUE FROM M_INIFILE_CONTENTS WHERE FILE_NAME = 'global.ini' AND SECTION= 'memorymanager' AND KEY = 'gc_unused_memory_threshold_abs' AND (LAYER_NAME = 'DATABASE' OR LAYER_NAME = 'DEFAULT') AND VALUE > '0'

actions.description: Both garbage collection parameters is set to a default value . To address the risk of hiccups (e.g. due to MemoryReclaim waits), gc_unused_memory_threshold_rel needs to be set to value of 25% or gc_unused_memory_threshold_abs to a value 25% of allocation_limit.
